'''Elekid''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''エレキッド''' ''Elekid'') is an {{type|Electric}} [[baby Pokémon]] introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Electabuzz}} starting at [[level]] 30, which evolves into {{p|Electivire}} when [[trade]]d holding an [[Electirizer]].

==Biology==
Elekid is a yellow, round-bodied Pokémon with black stripes. Elekid's arms are bulky in proportion to its body, and it has three claws instead of fingers. It has two stripes on its arms, which wrap all the way around. There are two horns on top of its head which resemble the prongs of a plug, complete with holes in their sides. Elekid has a black lightning bolt marking on its chest. Two rows of stripes are near the marking, with the pattern continuing around its lower back. Its legs are black, and its feet are rounded and toeless.

Elekid tends to play out in the middle of thunderstorms. By rotating its arms, it generates electricity. However, it tires easily and can only charge a small amount. A weak electrical charge travels between its horns as well. It lives in the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands.}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Lulu Elekid.png|thumb|left|200px|Elekid in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Elekid Egg.png|thumb|left|200px|An Elekid {{pkmn|Egg}} in the anime]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Paul's Electivire|Paul's Elekid]]====
[[Paul]] owned an Elekid. He used it to battle to battle [[Ash's Pikachu]] in ''[[DP003|When Pokémon Worlds Collide!]]'' and [[Roark]] in ''[[DP015|Shapes of Things to Come]]''. Paul's Elekid evolved into Electabuzz in ''[[DP052|Smells Like Team Spirit]]'', and evolved into Electivire off-screen, prior to ''[[DP184|Casting a Paul on Barry!]]''.

====Other====
Elekid debuted in ''[[PK04|Pikachu's Rescue Adventure]]'', where it quickly became friends with {{AP|Pikachu}}. The little Electric Pokémon decided to assist Pikachu and his friends in finding {{TP|Misty|Togepi|Togetic}}. Elekid even stood by Pikachu's side when he was trying to prevent lightning from striking the Giant Tree.

Elekid made its main series debut in ''[[EP261|Here's Lookin' at You, Elekid]]'', where it was captured by {{an|Casey}}. It is one of her favorite Pokémon and thus was seen with her in ''[[SS011|A Date With Delcatty]]'' and ''[[SS017|Those Darn Electabuzz!]]''.

In ''[[AG154|Reversing the Charges]]'', an Elekid had absorbed a high amount of lightning and was electrifying every other Pokémon in sight. The Electric Pokémon calmed down and returned to its normal self after battling Ash's Pikachu.

An Elekid who works with {{OBP|Lulu|DP137}} appeared in ''[[DP137|Three Sides to Every Story!]]''. Along with {{TP|Dawn|Piplup}}, it fell in love with Lulu's {{p|Marill}}.

An Elekid appeared in ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]'' alongside an {{p|Electabuzz}} and {{p|Electivire}}, all under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Baccer World Cup]] participant.

An Elekid appeared in a fantasy in ''[[XY009|Clemont's Got a Secret!]]''.

Two Trainers' Elekid appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]'' and ''[[SM007|That's Why the Litten is a Scamp!‬]]''.

A Trainer's Elekid appeared in ''[[SM002|The Guardian's Challenge]]''. It appeared again in [[SM064]].

A Trainer's Elekid appeared in ''[[SM004|First Catch in Alola, Ketchum-Style!]]''.

A Trainer's Elekid appeared in ''[[SM013|Racing to a Big Event!]]'', where it participated in the Pancake Race.

Three Trainers' Elekid appeared in ''[[SM017|Crystal-Clear Sleuthing!]]''.

An Elekid will appear in [[M21]], under the ownership of a Trainer.

==In the manga==
[[File:Volkner Elekid Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Elekid in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Ken of the [[Team Rocket Elite Trio]] is seen with an Elekid in ''[[PS094|Elekid Incorporated]]'', though she easily loses to {{adv|Silver}}'s newly obtained {{p|Totodile}} despite having the type-advantage. She appears again in ''[[PS100|Into the Unown]]'', battling against {{adv|Gold}}'s Pokémon. She was used in an attempt to capture Suicune in ''[[PS127|Miltank Melee]]'', she temporarily fell asleep by {{DL|Crystal (Adventures)|Parasee}}'s Spore in ''[[PS128|Indubitably Ditto]]''. She was later used to induce electricity on Spinarak's web to surround Eusine and Harry in ''[[PS129|Great Girafarig]]'', after Harry's Girafarig had been defeated she along with Al's Spinarak had quietly escaped.

A wild Elekid was captured by Crystal near an amusement park in ''[[PS119|A Flaaffy Kerfuffle]]'', and was later sent to {{adv|Professor Oak}}.

[[Volkner]] has an Elekid which he uses in his battle against {{adv|Platinum}} in ''[[PS404|Encountering Elekid]]''.

In ''[[PS442|Out-Odding Oddish]]'', an Elekid appeared in the [[Pokéathlon]].

In ''[[PS446|Weavile Wobbles But It Won't Fall Down]]'', a Trainer at the [[Johto Safari Zone|Safari Zone]] owns one.

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
Elekid is one of the Pokémon owned by {{GnB|Gold}} in [[Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys]].

==Trivia==
* Elekid and its {{p|Electabuzz|evolution}} share their {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Zapdos}}. They are all known as the Electric Pokémon.

===Origin===
Elekid is based on U.S. and Japanese {{wp|AC power plugs and sockets|AC power plugs}}.

====Name origin====
Elekid is a combination of ''electric'' and ''kid''.
